definitions.definition: A bisector , which divides into two equal parts.

An envelope, card, or fragment thereof showing an affixed cut half of a regular issued stamp , over which one or more postal markings have been applied. Typically used in wartime when normal lower rate stamps may not be available.

main_definition: ( geometry ) A bisector , which divides into two equal parts.
secondary_definitions: ( philately ) An envelope, card, or fragment thereof showing an affixed cut half of a regular issued stamp , over which one or more postal markings have been applied. Typically used in wartime when normal lower rate stamps may not be available.
